definition: to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile

sentences.english: When SSH jokes, he will turn his head and look for KTHsreaction.
sentences.chinese: 宋承宪讲冷笑话的时间回头视察泰熙反映。

sentences.english: The cold smile on his face made me guess that he considered himself to be superior to others.
sentences.chinese: 从他脸上的冷笑我猜想到他自以为高人一等。

sentences.english: Become Long Xing's ruddy Yan sneer by two, this just immediately afterward mention.
sentences.chinese: 化成龙形的赤焰冷笑了两声，这才接着说道。

sentences.english: A melancholy fold, which resembled the beginning of irony, wrinkled her right cheek.
sentences.chinese: 一条含愁的皱痕横在她的右脸上，仿佛是冷笑的起始。

sentences.english: I was uncomfortable with his sneer.
sentences.chinese: 他的冷笑使我很不舒服。

sentences.english: The moxa Er a kind of insect sneers at, seeing to him isn't likely to help oneself again.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔莎冷笑，看来他是不可能再帮自己了。

sentences.english: When SSH jokes he will turn his head and look for KTH's reaction.
sentences.chinese: 宋承宪讲冷笑话的时候转头观察泰熙反应。

sentences.english: He told a dry joke to break the ice.
sentences.chinese: 他讲了个冷笑话来打破沉默。

sentences.english: He listened to the conversation with Ye Jingqi Tian Ji, sneer at.
sentences.chinese: 他听了田继业和叶靖奇的谈话，冷笑不已。

sentences.english: Work is one thellong and play is another.
sentences.chinese: 工作是一钱枫冷笑话回事，游玩又是另一回事。

sentences.english: Ambreene favored him with a disbelieving sneer.
sentences.chinese: 艾布瑞妮回以一个不相信的冷笑。

sentences.english: The markets greeted the first cut with a sneer.
sentences.chinese: 市场带着冷笑迎接第一次降息。

sentences.english: A smile, frown, raised eyebrow, yawn, and sneer all convey information.
sentences.chinese: 微笑，蹙额，提眉，哈欠和冷笑都传递着信息。

definition: to force a smile/a bitter laugh
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to cast sidelong glances at sb
